snippet: The 13th annual report from Interbrand ranks what it deems the 100 most valuable brands worldwide, and Coca-Cola, Apple, I.B.M. and Google lead the list.
abstract: Stuart Elliott Advertising column notes 13th annual report from Interbrand ranks what it deems the 100 most valuable brands worldwide, and Coca-Cola, Apple, IBM and Google lead the list.

headline.main: List of Global Brands Keeps Coke on Top, and Apple Jumps Up
headline.print_headline: List of Global Brands Keeps Coke on Top, And Apple Jumps Up

snippet: The “liquidity” high-frequency trading provides is long past the point of being helpful.
abstract: Op-Ed article by author Roger Lowenstein notes that American regulators are finally examining the dangers posed by high-frequency trading, which has caused several market disasters in the past year; contends that strong measures are needed to curb practice, which has changed the stock market from a source of liquidity into hub for fast-paced gambling.

headline.main: A Speed Limit for the Stock Market
headline.print_headline: A Speed Limit for the Stock Market

snippet: The technology reporters and editors of The New York Times scour the Web for important and peculiar items. Monday's selection includes a lot of news being read on tablets in the morning and at night, a surge in the use of prefabricated mobile data...
abstract: The technology reporters and editors of The New York Times scour the Web for important and peculiar items. Monday's selection includes a lot of news being read on tablets in the morning and at night, a surge in the use of prefabricated mobile data centers and a study that says looking at pictures of cute baby animals can promote more careful work.

headline.main: Today's Scuttlebot: Debate Animations, and Apple's Taiwanese Network

snippet: The police have been seeking a man who wielded a syringe in a spate of thefts of Apple products in the Bronx in September.
abstract: The police have been seeking a man who wielded a syringe in a spate of thefts of Apple products in the Bronx in September.

headline.main: Arrest Made in Robberies Using Hypodermic Needle

snippet: Creatures that do violent things to their heads, like wild pigs and woodpeckers, have very dense skulls, small brains and little fluid to reduce the chance of damage.
To the checklist of signs that the technology industry has entered a "post-PC" era, add this: Google's stock market value passed that of Microsoft's for the first time on Monday.
abstract: To the checklist of signs that the technology industry has entered a "post-PC" era, add this: Google's stock market value passed that of Microsoft's for the first time on Monday.

headline.main: Google Leapfrogs Microsoft in Market Value
headline.print_headline: Google Leapfrogs Microsoft in Market Value

byline.original: By NICK WINGFIELD and CLAIRE CAIN MILLER

snippet: A leading technology research firm has cut its 2012 forecast for shipments of ultrabooks by more than 50 percent. Ultrabooks were supposed to revitalize the personal computer market, but have been slow to market, generally unmemorable in their adv...
abstract: A leading technology research firm has cut its 2012 forecast for shipments of ultrabooks by more than 50 percent. Ultrabooks were supposed to revitalize the personal computer market, but have been slow to market, generally unmemorable in their advertising and more expensive than expected.

headline.main: Ultrabooks Still Fail to Catch On

snippet: In an effort to build credibility among new technology companies, law firms like Wilson Sonsini are employing a broad set of tools, including free services and blogs.
abstract: In an effort to build credibility among new technology companies, law firms like Wilson Sonsini are employing a broad set of tools, including free services and blogs.

headline.main: Law Firms Mine San Francisco for Internet Start-Up Gold
headline.print_headline: Law Firms Mine San Francisco for Internet Start-Up Gold

snippet: Owners of Apple's new iPhone 5 may notice that the phone is guzzling more bytes over the cellular network on Verizon Wireless than it should, which could lead to a hefty bill. It turns out there's a bug.
abstract: Owners of Apple's new iPhone 5 may notice that the phone is guzzling more bytes over the cellular network on Verizon Wireless than it should, which could lead to a hefty bill. It turns out there's a bug.

headline.main: IPhone 5 May Burn Through Excessive Cell Data on Verizon

snippet: Square, the mobile payments company, bought a small design firm in New York, 80/20, and opened a New York office. The acquisition is the latest example of how designers have become some of the most highly prized employees for Silicon Valley compan...
abstract: Square, the mobile payments company, bought a small design firm in New York, 80/20, and opened a New York office. The acquisition is the latest example of how designers have become some of the most highly prized employees for Silicon Valley companies.

headline.main: Square Acquires a New York Design Firm
